name: Husa Avenida Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from 5 days in Barcelona - fabulous trip.
reviews.title: Fabulous, loved it

likes.liked: — Location, staff, decor - too difficult to choose only one
likes.disliked: — Absolutely nothing to dislike, loved it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Avenida Place was top notch - our room was a good size, well furnished and best of all had a small balcony with floor to ceiling doors. We were on the first floor at the front of the hotel, and the noise was not a problem at all (and we slept with the doors open). The hotel lobby is very ornate and good for picture opportunities.
reviews.title: Best Location in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best of all the staff were so helpful and friendly - they booked dinner and entertainment for us, offered advice on places to visit and when we left every morning made sure we knew how we were getting to them. I'm planning another trip to Barcelona and will definitely stay at the Avenida again - I cannot think of one thing to criticise.
reviews.title: Centre of Everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mx
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in a convenience location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very well located in Barcelona, away from the noise and bustle of the Ramblas but close enough to be able to walk to the central square from where you can organise your tour of Barcelona. The rooms were clean and well maintained and the staff were helpful and friendly, they all spoke very good English too. The rooms had air conditioning which was very much appreciated as it was 30 degrees in August only going down to 26 degrees in the nightime.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The main benefit of this hotel is the locationclose to the upper end of La Rambla and just by the Passeig de Gracia tube station and round the corner from the Gaudi House (very impressive by the way).
reviews.title: Great Location but overrated hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were however disappointed with the hotel. We found the staff on reception rather abrupt and unhelpful. The room was dark and the view from the window straight into an office is a building less than a few meters away. There was no bar to speak of in the hotel, and although there was a very limited bar menu scattered around the tables in the foyer area but there was never any sign of anyone serving drinks.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a guy playing the piano in the reception area that made for a nice area but there was never anyone around to hear it as there was no bar.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, except for the metro noise

likes.disliked: — Trains from the metro station shaking our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall its not a terrible hotel but overpriced in my opinion and while we loved barcelona i think we'd choose another hotel next time.
reviews.title: Great location - Good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My son and I spent three nights at the Avenida Palace. I can't imagine a better place to stay in Barcelona. The location is terrific -- close to the upper end of La Rambla and just off the Passeig de Gracia -- within easy walking distance of the lovely buildings in the Manzana de la Discordia as well as bustling Placa Catalunya. The friendly and extremely helpful staff truly make Avenida Palace a treat for travelers. The front desk staff are always very pleasant and make guests feel welcome in any language. The breakfast buffet is extensive and a wonderful way to get ready for a full day of sightseeing (if you are traveling with children, be sure to ask for a pot of chocolate at breakfast -- my son loved it). The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. We will definitely choose the Avenida Palace the next time we are in lovely, lovely Barcelona.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideal for La Rambla and the Barca tourist.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — no coffee making facilities in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel clean, staff friendly and helpful, no coffee facilities in room (disappointing) room small, bed huge. Overall still good value and I would stay there again.
reviews.title: good hotel, good spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Plenty restaurants nearby, buy go off the Ramblas for better value. Can recommend Los Caracoles off behind the white statute at bottom of Ramblas.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Taxis reasonable, 5 Euro from Estacio Del Nord to hotel. Metro great value and simple to use, buy a multi Person multi journey ticket from machine in stations.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the extra charges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Big bus great value for money 2 days 26 Euro.
reviews.title: Suberb Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was everything I imagined it to be and more-it has to be seen to be believed!!The location of this breathtakingly beautiful hotel is perfect -close to La Rambla and a short walk to the old harbour 'Port Vell' and the Olympic harbour.Transport from the airport via train is easy and convient and will take you to Passeig de Gracia and from there it is a short walk to the hotel.Within the vacinity of the hotel there are plenty of cafes and restaurants offering good food and outside eateries create a relaxed ambience for dinning.The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating and our room was immaculate(as was the entire hotel)The buffet breakfast was excellent-fresh and plentiful.
reviews.title: Stunningly Opulent Hotel

likes.liked: — location/historical opulence of Hotel Avenida Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a long weekend at the Avenida Palace. This is an old-style, elegant hotel - the antithesis of the lately-popular ultra-modern, minimalist establishments (where we also enjoy staying from time to time). The staff is friendly and multi-lingual. Our room was large with a comfortable king-size bed and two chairs, so that we were both able to sit and watch the flat screen TV. The bathroom was large and supplied with plenty of towels, a good shower and a decent-size soap. We were not bothered by any noise from other rooms nor from outside. Having read reviews from other travelers, we decided to skip the 20 euro per person breakfast buffet and went round the corner to have a continental breakfast for 1/4 the price. Logging on to internet is a bit expensive at 5 euros for 15 min. Other hotels of this category provide internet service for free. We avoided using anything from the mini-bar since the prices are also quite high.
reviews.title: Good hotel - Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is ideal for seeing the sights and shopping. Bus and metro stops are a few steps away at the corner of Passeig de Gracia. It's an easy walk to Plaza Catalunya and then down the Ramblas and into the Barrio Gotico. Good places to eat near the hotel are Txapela, just up the Passeig de Gracia, for tapas, and La Tramoia, for tapas or a full meal, very near the hotel.
reviews.title: Good loaction but not so good hotel

likes.disliked: — Darkness and lack of air conditioning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights late November 08. Although a good location with easy access to train/underground I would not stay again. The central heating was useless and each day and night the room was far too hot, if you opened the windows you then got the heavy traffic noise and pollution, when reported to staff I was told that there was NO air conditioning.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel ..........if they fix the air con !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room safe door was broken and the room was probably the darkest room I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: perfect hotel in perfect location

description: The Hotel Avenida Palace is a classic part of Barcelona. It has been recently refurbished and is blessed by its prime location in the city centre. It offers 151 comfortable, recently refurbished rooms that have retained their classic yet functional décor. The rooms are well-appointed and have en-suite bathrooms as well as a digital ISDN line with modem connection. The "Insolit Barcelona" restaurant is open every day. Room service is available. The hotel boasts 7 function rooms for between 25 and 300 people, all of which have an analogue telephone line for computer connections. Audio-visual and technical equipment is available for clients, and there is a hairdressing and massage service.
